sentences.text:
Presidential elections were held in Slovakia in March and April 2024. Incumbent president Zuzana Čaputová announced in June 2023 that she would not run for a second term.
	
In the first round held on 23 March, Ivan Korčok led with 43% of the votes followed by Peter Pellegrini with 37%. As no candidate received a majority, a runoff was scheduled between the two on 6 April. However, in the second round, Pellegrini defeated Korčok with 53% of the vote. He was sworn in as president on 15 June.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web|title=Reakcie na rozhodnutie prezidentky / Pavel vyjadril Čaputovej uznanie, Kiska cíti smútok a Smer ju kritizuje|url=https://www.postoj.sk/132724/dnes-treba-vediet|access-date=29 June 2023|website=Postoj.sk|language=sk|archive-date=29 June 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230629081249/https://www.postoj.sk/132724/dnes-treba-vediet|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web|title=Korčok wins the first round of Slovakia's presidential election |url=https://spectator.sme.sk/c/23300627/korcok-wins-the-first-round-of-slovakias-presidential-election.html|website=The Slovak Spectator|date=23 March 2024|access-date=7 April 2024}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-03-23 |title=Slovakia: Presidential election proceeds to runoff |url=https://www.dw.com/en/slovakia-presidential-election-proceeds-to-runoff/a-68652919 |access-date=2024-04-07 |website=Deutche Welle}}</ref>

sentences.text: The President of Slovakia is elected using the two-round system; if no candidate gains a majority in the first round, a runoff will be held between the top-two candidates.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web|title=Slovak Republic: Election for president|url=https://www.electionguide.org/elections/id/3140/|website=electionguide.org|date=16 March 2019|access-date=13 November 2021|archive-date=13 November 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211113231412/https://www.electionguide.org/elections/id/3140/|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: Slovak citizens not sentenced for an intentional crime aged 40 or more are eligible to run for the office of president.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web|title=Prezidentské voľby: Kto môže kandidovať na prezidenta?|url=https://www.aktuality.sk/clanok/660240/prezidentske-volby-2024-kto-moze-kandidovat-za-prezidenta/|website=Aktuality.sk|date=23 January 2019|access-date=31 January 2024|language=sk|archive-date=31 January 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240131163723/https://www.aktuality.sk/clanok/660240/prezidentske-volby-2024-kto-moze-kandidovat-za-prezidenta/|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text:
*Marta Čurajová, lecturer, judicial reform advocate. Launched the campaign on 19 December 2023 as an Independent politician|independent candidate.
*Peter Kuťka, Entertainer, influencer. Launched the campaign on 12 December 2023 as an Independent politician|independent candidate.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web|title="Nezávislá, apolitická a národná kandidátka." O post prezidenta má záujem aj Čurajová|url=https://spravy.pravda.sk/prezidentske-volby-2024/clanok/693312-nezavisla-apoliticka-a-narodna-kandidatka-o-post-prezidenta-ma-zaujem-aj-curajova/|date=19 December 2023|access-date=9 January 2024|website=Pravda (Slovakia)|Pravda|language=sk|archive-date=9 January 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240109093301/https://spravy.pravda.sk/prezidentske-volby-2024/clanok/693312-nezavisla-apoliticka-a-narodna-kandidatka-o-post-prezidenta-ma-zaujem-aj-curajova/|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text:
*{{ill|Ján Drgonec|sk}}, former justice of the Supreme Court of the Slovak Republic|Supreme Court, former MP for Alliance of the New Citizen|ANO. Announced candidacy in March 2023. Collection of required 15-thousand signatures was in progress as of November 2023. In January 2024, he stopped the signature collection.
*Beáta Janočková, civil and parental rights activist. Announced candidacy as an independent candidate on 13 November 2023, initiating the collection of 15-thousand signatures to support her candidacy.
*Miroslav Radačovský, Member of the European Parliament|MEP. Announced his candidacy on 10 January 2024. He withdrew his candidacy in early February.
* Andrej Danko, Deputy Speaker of the National Council. Withdrew candidacy on 18 March 2024 endorsing Štefan Harabin.
* Róbert Švec, Chairman of the {{ill|Slovak Revival Movement|sk|Slovenské Hnutie Obrody}}. Withdrew candidacy on 20 March 2024 endorsing Štefan Harabin.

sentences.text: Following the results of the first round, Korčok said that he acknowledged a "need to reach out more to voters who supported the government parties,” adding that it was also clear that “they’re not satisfied with how this government is ruling, where it’s taking Slovakia.” Pellegrini congratulated Korčok for his first place and pledged to hold “several duels, as it should be” with Korčok before the second round, and “not to succumb” to an aggressive campaign style, having only engaged once in a debate prior to the first round of voting. He also noted that a majority of voters voted for nationalist candidates and not "a liberal, progressive" candidate, and predicted the second round of voting to be a tight race.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=Slovak president election: Pro-EU diplomat tops coalition stalwart in first round |url=https://www.politico.eu/article/coalition-stalwart-edges-pro-eu-opponent-in-first-round-slovak-presidential-ballot/ |access-date=2024-03-24 |website=Politico |date=23 March 2024 |language=en |archive-date=24 March 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240324142549/https://www.politico.eu/article/coalition-stalwart-edges-pro-eu-opponent-in-first-round-slovak-presidential-ballot/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |title=A pro-West diplomat and an ally of populist premier to meet in runoff for Slovakia's presidency |url=https://apnews.com/article/slovakia-president-election-fist-round-a2aedaa45c03362ccc0aa478c43404f4|website=Associated Press |date=23 March 2024 |access-date=24 March 2024|archive-date=24 March 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240324142549/https://apnews.com/article/slovakia-president-election-fist-round-a2aedaa45c03362ccc0aa478c43404f4 |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |title=Slovakia's pro-West diplomat Korcok to face off with Fico ally Pelligrini in presidential runoff |url=https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20240324-pro-ukraine-korcok-ex-pm-pellegrini-set-for-slovakia-presidential-runoff|website=France 24|date=24 March 2024|archive-date=24 March 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240324152409/https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20240324-pro-ukraine-korcok-ex-pm-pellegrini-set-for-slovakia-presidential-runoff |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: President Čaputová denounced war rhetoric used during the campaigning for the second round and defended both Pellegrini and Korčok from allegations that they were willing to deploy soldiers in Ukraine.

sentences.text: In the second round, Pellegrini carried 61 out of 79 Districts of Slovakia|districts.

references.text: <ref name="Aktuality.sk 2023">{{cite web | title=Výsledky prezidentských volieb 2. kolo Live |url=https://www.aktuality.sk/udalost/prezidentske-volby-2024/vysledky/| website=Aktuality.sk | language=sk|date=3 October 2023|access-date=6 April 2024| archive-date=7 April 2024 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240407060845/https://www.aktuality.sk/udalost/prezidentske-volby-2024/vysledky/ | url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Following the results, Pellegrini pledged to be "a president of all Slovak citizens" and "be always by the side of Slovakia." Korčok conceded defeat and congratulated Pellegrini, while acknowledging that he was "disappointed" by the electoral result.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=A close ally of populist prime minister tops a pro-Western diplomat to become Slovakia's president |url=https://apnews.com/article/slovakia-presidential-election-korcok-pellegrini-fico-c7c4873395ddae50bd4ead0304da8297|website=Associated Press |date=7 April 2024 |archive-date=7 April 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240407062730/https://apnews.com/article/slovakia-presidential-election-korcok-pellegrini-fico-c7c4873395ddae50bd4ead0304da8297 |url-status=live }}</ref>
